detail.name: Fresh Banana, Each
detail.short_description: Enhance breakfast and baking dishes by incorporating fresh Banana (Guineo) Fruit into family-favorite recipes. Each banana is a versatile fruit that's packed with potassium and dietary fiber to help maintain a balanced and nutritional diet. They're essential to a wealth of traditional recipes, as well as a healthy, easy snack the entire family will enjoy. Their soft, ripened fruit is a favorite of all ages and offers a sweet and delicious bite that makes a tasty smoothie and snack addition. Raw bananas have a universal use that complements many flavors and can easily add a different and delicious dimension to ice cream and dessert treats.
detail.long_description:
• Fresh produce
  • Easy-to-peel bananas
  • Can be enjoyed raw or cooked
  • Can elevate dessert and breakfast recipes

top_reviews.review_text:
Walmart's banana quality is generally satisfactory, reflecting the retail giant's commitment to offering fresh produce. The bananas are typically ripe and ready for consumption upon purchase, catering to customers with immediate consumption in mind. The convenience of finding bananas at competitive prices is a notable advantage for shoppers on a budget.

However, occasional inconsistencies may arise, with some customers reporting variations in ripeness levels within a bunch. While this is not a widespread issue, it highlights the importance of inspecting individual bananas before purchase. Walmart's commitment to sustainability is evident through its efforts to source bananas responsibly, often adhering to ethical and environmental standards.

Packaging practices contribute to maintaining the bananas' freshness during transit, minimizing the likelihood of bruising or damage. Walmart's vast supply chain ensures a steady and reliable stock of bananas, contributing to the accessibility of this staple fruit for a diverse customer base.

In summary, Walmart's banana quality is generally commendable, offering affordability and accessibility. While some minor inconsistencies may occur, the overall experience aligns with the expectations of a mainstream grocery retailer. Customers seeking a reliable source of bananas at competitive prices will find Walmart's offerings suitable for their needs.

WHEN I ORDER BANANAS I ONLY ORDER 2 MAYBE 3. I LIKE THEM WITH SOME GREEN TO IT SO I DO NOT HAVE TO EAT THEM SO FAST OR GO BAD. I LIKE PUTTING THEM ON MY PANCAKES. YUM. UNFORTUNATELY I ORDERED 2 BANANAS THIS TIME AND ONLY GOT 1. I AM NOT GOING TO MAKE A BIG DEAL OF IT THOUGH AND THE ONE I GOT HAS BROWN SPOTS ALL OVER THE PEELING. THANK YOU ANYWAY.

the reason I rated this product is because who ever pulls the produce. they either take care on good picking and others don't. I would order buy more fresh produce if they do it right. Now i have to wait till i get a ride to Walmart or another place. ( Sprouts,Publix or Winn-Dixie)

Walmart at 35150 is buying various off brand bananas that are not nearly as flavorful as Chiquita or Dole. Other surrounding WMs buy branded bananas that hold their freshness longer and just taste better overall.  A couple cents/lb is not worth it.  Offer us good stuff WM!

I'm not sure who upset my shopper today. But they need to apologize because I ordered 6 bananas. I didn't specify size. Just that wanted 6. Welp I got a variety of all sizes and ripeness. All single bananas. No bundle. Just looked as if they just grabbed one from this bundle and that bundle. Who does that? Just grab a bundle of 6 or 5 and one extra or 4 and 2 extra, etc. have never gotten all individual bananas to now have to lay on my counter versus hanging on my banana rack. Guess I'm going to have to start specifying a bundle in the description box ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

The whole  Walmart experience lately has just been blah  I ordered two bananas and 2 lb of grapes my one banana came wrapped up in a bag couldn't even find it but that's the first thing I asked for when I got my delivery was my fruit cuz I got a raw chicken last week wanted to make sure it wasn't smashed up the fruit I'm talking about well after further investigation of my groceries I got one banana and a half eaten or Miss packed bag of grapes.

Bananas were disgusting!  You need to do better Wal-Mart produce buyers.   Both the regular and so-called organic ones are delivered over ripe, bruised and disgusting.  I cannot blame the pickers/drivers, I know they would not pick such terrible looking bananas, you need to put out a better selection that lasts longer or something - do better!!!  Give us a choice on-line to pick green ones or ripe ones and large or small please!  It's been requested before by many, many customers, please listen to us!!!  I'm a senior so 4 or 5 bananas need to last all week, you give me ripe yellow bananas, they're bad before I can use them.  I need small, green ones, others need large, ripe yellow ones!  LISTEN TO US!!!  Please....

Worst shopped bananas in my order history. Overripe and multiple brown spots. Asked for a refund but Walmart wanted me to return them to the store. I could not keep them long enough for my next trip to the store they were already attracting fruit flies.

top_reviews.review_title: Smashed items and open food jars
top_reviews.review_text: I just love it when I get my groceries home and notice that the peanut butter has been opened and you can clearly see that some has put their fingers in it. Plus the chips are smashed    The ice cream carton is smashed. This review will be a waste of time. Walmart doesn't care!!

Walmart produce is horrible.  No matter what i buy it doesn't last more than 2 days.  Every time i get bananas they are brown and mushy within a few days and i have to throw them away. Ive even had out dated salads and such delivered when doing a delivery order.  Completely unacceptable!!

directions.value: Handle with care. Keep at 58 degrees F or 14 degrees C.
